workflow.name: Lightroom cloud to Instagram auto poster (AI captions)
workflow.description:
**Automatically publish Lightroom photos to Instagram** with short, human-sounding AI captions. This workflow pulls the next item from your Data Table queue, generates an on-brand caption from alt text + metadata, uploads via Instagram Graph API, and marks it posted. 
Use it together with ‚ÄúLightroom Cloud ‚Üí Photos Queue (AI Alt Text)‚Äù and ‚ÄúLightroom Image Webhook (Direct JPEG for Instagram).‚Äù

## What it‚Äôs for

Hands-free Lightroom-to-Instagram posting: schedule, caption with AI, and publish consistently using the Instagram Graph API.

## Parameters to set

- Instagram Graph API access token and Instagram Business/Creator account ID
- Posting schedule (cron/interval) + max posts per run
- Data Table name & status fields (posted timestamp, IG media ID)
- Caption rules: tone, max length, hashtags policy, CTA style
- Image source URL: public endpoint of Workflow 2 (Lightroom Image Webhook)

## Works best with

Workflow 1: **[Lightroom Cloud ‚Üí Photos Queue (AI Alt Text)](https://n8n.io/workflows/9692-automate-lightroom-to-instagram-with-claude-ai-alt-text-generator/)**

Workflow 2: **Lightroom Image Webhook (Direct JPEG for Instagram)**

## Learn more & stay in the loop

Want the full story (decisions, trade-offs, and tips) behind this **Lightroom Cloud ‚Üí Instagram automation**?  
üëâ **Read the write-up on my blog: [camilleroux.com](https://www.camilleroux.com/automatiser-la-publication-de-photos-lightroom-sur-instagram-avec-n8n/)**

If you enjoy **street & urban photography** or you‚Äôre curious how I use these n8n workflows day-to-day:  
üëâ **Follow my photo account on Instagram:** **[@camillerouxphoto](https://www.instagram.com/camillerouxphoto/)**  
üëâ **Follow me on other networks:** links available on [my site](https://www.camilleroux.com) (X, Bluesky, Mastodon, Threads)

parameters.content:
### Instagram Auto-Publisher (Lightroom ‚Üí IG)

**Purpose**  
Pick the next unposted photo from **Photos**, build a caption from **ALT + EXIF**, publish via **Instagram Graph API**, then mark it as posted.

**Must-configure**
- **IG setup:** Instagram **Business/Creator** linked to a **Facebook Page** (Graph API **v23.0**, **long-lived** token).
- **n8n domain:** Publicly reachable base URL for the Lightroom image webhook.
- **Lightroom IDs:** Your **LR catalog ID** and asset IDs available in the data table.
- **Data Table (Photos) columns:** `lr_asset_id`, `alt`, `lr_asset`, `ig_posted_at`, `ig_id`, `ig_caption`.
- **LLM credentials:** Anthropic (or equivalent) for caption generation.
- **Selection rule:** Filter rows where **`ig_posted_at` is empty** (only unposted).
- **Posting cap:** Set your **max posts per run** (the Limit node value).
- **Schedule:** Your preferred **times/cron** for auto-publishing.
- **Params node**

values.content:
=**ROLE**  
You write an Instagram caption from ALT text and EXIF metadata. Optimize for search and engagement **without inventing** anything.

**INPUTS**  
- `ALT`: {{ $('Limit').item.json.alt }}  
- `EXIF (JSON or text)`: {{ JSON.stringify(JSON.parse($json.lr_asset).payload) }}

**GOAL**  
Produce **exactly 3 lines** under **220 total characters** (line breaks included):  
1) **Action phrase (-ing) + brief outcome**; include **1‚Äì2 intent terms** from ALT if present (e.g., ‚Äúportrait‚Äù, ‚Äúlong exposure‚Äù). **Max 12 words.**  
2) **Gear & settings** on one line with an en dash:  
   `<CameraModel> + <Lens> ‚Äî <Shutter> ¬∑ f/<Aperture> ¬∑ ISO <ISO> ¬∑ WB <KelvinIfKnown>`  
   - Use EXIF fields **only if present**: make/cameraModel, lensModel, focalLength and FocalLengthIn35mmFilm, fNumber, exposureTime, iso, whiteBalance (Kelvin or ‚ÄúAuto‚Äù).  
   - If focal length exists but not in lens name, **prefix it** (e.g., `35/1.8`). Display FocalLengthIn35mmFilm too (format: "(28 mm eq. 35 mm)")
   - Format shutter `1/250s`; aperture `f/1.8`.  
   - Missing field? **Omit** it. **No inference.**
3) **5‚Äì10 hashtags** (lowercase, **deduped**) using layered strategy:  
   - **Broad:** always `#photography` + **one** brand/lens tag if present (e.g., `#fujifilm #fujifilmxseries
 #fujilove`, `#xe5`).  
   - **Mid-tail:** 1‚Äì3 subject/genre from ALT (e.g., `#portrait`, `#streetphotography`).  
   - **Niche:** 1‚Äì2 specific technique/gear terms from ALT/EXIF.  
   - **Location:** add 1‚Äì2 only if GPS/city exists in EXIF (e.g., `#paris`, `#montmartre`).
   - **Mentions:** if the EXIF description/caption/title/userComment contains Instagram-style mentions (e.g., `@name`), **append them verbatim at the end of line 3 after the hashtags**. Deduplicate; do not invent; preserve exact handles. If the 220-character limit is exceeded, **remove niche hashtags first**, then mid-tail if needed, but keep mentions.


**STYLE & SEO RULES**  
- English only. Human, concise, non-salesy.  
- No emojis unless clearly in ALT. No quotes. **No trailing spaces.**  
- **Zero inference:** do not assert people/brands/places/conditions not in ALT/EXIF.  
- **Deduplicate intelligently:** avoid repeating the exact same keyword in line 1 and hashtags if it reduces variety; keep the most useful mix for search.  
- Keep line 2 compact and readable (models/settings aid search without spam).

**OUTPUT (exact format)**  
<action + outcome with intent terms>
<gear & settings>
<hashtags>

parameters.content: ## STEP1 - Select the next image to publish
## STEP2 - Generate the description with AI
